alert.note: Alert for Eastern Lincoln County; Southwest Chaves County (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 01 at 4:20PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHERN LINCOLN AND WEST CENTRAL CHAVES COUNTIES THROUGH 445 PM MDT... At 419 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Elk, or 11 miles northeast of Mayhill, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Elk. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. Accumulations of small hail on roads can create very slick and hazardous driving conditions.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Lincoln County; Southwest Chaves County
